@ "Congrats to Daemon for building the 5th known ship not to fit inside a drydock."

The Pandora was sort of an experiment to see just how big I could build a carrier. lol

Congrats to Daemon for building the 5th known ship not to fit inside a drydock.

Fr-21 would not even close to fit then. Any pics of this drydock?

I have a similar experiment.

The other 3 are.

-Comrade's Fr-21(take away the weapon tube and it does)

-Zeke's Wales class

-My Insanely ugly supercarrier(The dock fits inside this one:P)

EDIT:Lol,I'll take a picture of how they all fit.

Edited March 2, 2014 by Spartwo

That is one HUGE drydock there! Looks nice as well. Edit: Just noticed that it reminds me of the sins of a solar empire frigate factory.

I think when the NASA pack comes out with its big parts and 0.24's stronger joints then warship building is going to go through a revolution! Less struts will save on part count massively.

On top of that the K-drive changes things as well.

My latest craft

Its an attacker. Needs a name though (remember biblical or patriotic)
Attackers are the same as corvettes right?

Attackers are the same as corvettes right?

Negative, an attack is a class for fighter that is designed to attack ground targets or shipsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.Much like the A-10 warthog.

Its kinda like a small bomber

A corvette is a class of naval ships designed for scouting, patrolling, or fast engagement of enemy capital ships.

Ground attack?Where are the VTOL engines,possibly landing gear and bombs.

I meant in terms of KSP not reality.In reality they are in different stages so a comparison is difficult if not impossible.

I meant in terms of KSP not reality.In reality they are in different stages so a comparison is difficult if not impossible.

Well its this craft is designed to be a space born craft. It has 4 guided missiles in the rear of the ship. The wing parts form a bomb bay
